name: ApplyActorAnimation
notes: You must preload the animation library for the player the actor will be applying the animation for, and not for the actor. Otherwise, the animation won't be applied to the actor until the function is executed again.
versions: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3.7 and will not work in earlier versions!
description: Apply an animation to an actor.
params_title: (actorid, animlib[], animname[], Float:fDelta, loop, lockx, locky, freeze, time)

params_body.name: actorid
params_body.description: The ID of the actor to apply the animation to.

params_body.name: animlib[]
params_body.description: The animation library from which to apply an animation.

params_body.name: animname[]
params_body.description: The name of the animation to apply, within the specified library.

params_body.name: fDelta
params_body.description: The speed to play the animation (use 4.1).

params_body.name: loop
params_body.description: If set to 1, the animation will loop. If set to 0, the animation will play once.

params_body.name: lockx
params_body.description: If set to 0, the actor is returned to their old X coordinate once the animation is complete (for animations that move the actor such as walking). 1 will not return them to their old position.

params_body.name: locky
params_body.description: Same as above but for the Y axis. Should be kept the same as the previous parameter.

params_body.name: freeze
params_body.description: Setting this to 1 will freeze an actor at the end of the animation. 0 will not.

params_body.name: time
params_body.description: Timer in milliseconds. For a never-ending loop it should be 0.

return_values: 0: The function failed to execute. The actor specified does not exist.
related_fn: ClearActorAnimations: Clear any animations that are applied to an actor.
